other_tests.findings: Adenocarcinoma was identified in all four cores, occupying 25 to 65% of the tissue. Gleason score was 7 (3 plus 4).
other_tests.changes_over_time: The Gleason score on subsequent radical prostatectomy was upgraded to 8 (4 plus 4), indicating tumor grade had been underestimated due to sampling error.

other_tests.findings: Extent of cancer with Gleason score of 8 (4 plus 4) indicated capsular penetration; the pathological stage was pT3N0.
BMD of the femoral neck and total hip were 0.72 g/cm² (T score -1.6) and 0.94 g/cm² (T score -0.6), respectively.
other_tests.changes_over_time: After 3 years of ADT, the bone mineral density of the femoral neck declined to 0.65 g/cm² (T score -2.1) and total hip to 0.84 g/cm² (T score -1.2).
18 months after prostatectomy, PSA level was elevated at 17.2 ng/ml.

other_tests.date: At last follow-up (13 years after diagnosis)

other_tests.findings: Marked right thoracic spinal scoliosis and nonspecific focal uptake consistent with degenerative joint disease.
